result.execSummary:
The defendant Daja L Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -Restitution for Target to be joint/several with the Co-Defendant. To be paid as a condition of probation.

-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

-Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
-Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
-No contact with the Co-Defendant and the Target store listed in the criminal complaint. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: -STAYED; to be used at the Agent's discretion. (Huber privileges at the Agent's discretion)
-To be completed as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daja L Harris

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Peter Wolff.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:19 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daja L Harris in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Daja L Harris.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed on the document.  Stat and Atty. Wolff confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Counts 2-4 dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Wolff.
Atty. Wolff also requests expungement.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Withheld sentence

Term of Probation: 2 Years

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with the Co-Defendant and the Target store listed in the Criminal Complaint.
-	Perform 20 Hours of Community Service.

Condition Time: 10 Days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion (Huber privileges at the Agent's discretion)

RESTITUTION: $1,416.99 to be paid to Target to be Joint/Several with the Co-Defendant.

COSTS:  $278.00 (includes DRGOD surcharge);

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
  
**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:43 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Zachary A Wittchow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daja L Harris in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Daja L Harris. Atty. Wolff provides an update, he is requesting a projected plea and sentencing date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Court conducts a collouqy with the defendant. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information, 
Defense accepts receipt of information, waives reading.
  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any Target Store.  Defendant to have no contact with the co-defendant (Santana V. Sprewer) listed in the Criminal Complaint.

02:18 PM Defendant Daja L Harris in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant provided a copy of the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
